results.firPara: Two decades after his one Southampton appearance, Ali Dia is the most famous phoney in the history of British football. But how did the move come about? And where is he now?
results.secPara: It is 20 years this Wednesday since Ali Dia graced the Premier League for 53 woefully inept minutes. Having been waved away by several other clubs, the striker ended up joining Graeme Souness at Southampton on the recommendation of someone pretending to be George Weah, and, due to injury problems, appeared from the bench against Leeds United after just one training session. Dia was so bad he was taken off, leaving Souness red-faced but ensuring two decades of laughter for the rest of us.
results.webTitle: 'What's this geezer doing? He's hopeless' – the Ali Dia story, 20 years on

results.firPara: Zlatan Ibrahimovic says he can see himself conquering the US, as I have with Europe in a wide-ranging interview to coincide with being named Swedens top player for the 10th successive year.
results.secPara: The Manchester United forward received his Guldbollen – Golden Ball – at a ceremony in Stockholm, extending a run of success that began in 2007. A bronze likeness of the 36-year-old will soon stand outside the Friends Arena stadium in the capital city, where Ibrahimovic scored a brilliant overhead kick in a four-goal haul against England in November 2012.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: ‘I can conquer America as I have with Europe’

results.firPara: Montreal and Toronto will face off in an all-Canadian tie for the right to face either Seattle or Colorado in the MLS Cup final
results.secPara: Seattle can be very Seattle. Renowned for being one of Americas most progressive cities, where same-sex marriage has been legal since 2012, where the minimum wage is higher than anywhere else in the US and where smoking marijuana is permitted, there is a certain spirit to the place that distinguishes it from anywhere else. That extends to sport.
results.webTitle: MLS conference finals: Canadian sides tangle and Sounders target maiden title

results.firPara: A report this week says 88% of US fans back pro-rel but a lack of any clear plan – or willingness on behalf of owners – remains an obstacle
results.secPara: A report this week says 88% of US fans back pro-rel but a lack of any clear plan – or willingness on behalf of owners – remains an obstacle
results.webTitle: Support for relegation in MLS remains high but don't hold your breath

results.firPara: Expansion seems to be a logical way to grow the game in Australia, but how best to go about that remains a divisive topic within the football community
results.secPara: Indulge me. Lets pretend for a second that football isnt a mass-entertainment product but rather a game about fans, anchored in communities. Lets also imagine that TV broadcasters and advertisers dont hold the absolute whip-hand when it comes to expansion locations.
results.webTitle: Guardian round table: our writers on the proposition of A-League expansion

results.firPara: • Former Anfield captain may be set for academy role
results.secPara: Steven Gerrard has turned down the chance to manage MK Dons and could now return to Liverpool in a coaching capacity.
results.webTitle: Steven Gerrard turns down MK Dons and could be set for Liverpool return

results.firPara: Spurs French goalkeeper believes they can defy the odds in Monaco and stay in the hunt for a place in the knock-out stages of Europes top competition
results.secPara: Spurs French goalkeeper believes they can defy the odds in Monaco and stay in the hunt for a place in the knock-out stages of Europes top competition
results.webTitle: Hugo Lloris confident Tottenham can keep Champions League hopes alive

results.firPara: José Mourinho has suggested Henrikh Mkhitaryan could not handle the pressure of playing in Manchester Uniteds 1-1 draw with Arsenal and instead told the forward he would be involved in Thursdays match with Feyenoord.
results.secPara: Mourinho believes Mkhitaryan, following a difficult start to his United career, is more likely to do himself justice in the Europa League. The Armenian has started only once in the Premier League – Septembers 2-1 defeat by Manchester City – and Mourinho replaced him at half-time.
results.webTitle: Henrikh Mkhitaryan would have struggled against Arsenal, says José Mourinho

results.firPara: Andy Woodwards harrowing account of the sexual abuse he suffered from the football coach Barry Bennell in the 1980s has led to six people coming forward to the police and the Football Association setting up a helpline for potential victims.
results.secPara: The police are now in the early stages of collating the new information and speaking to a number of former players who have contacted them since Woodward waived his anonymity to tell the Guardian he had been targeted for several years at Crewe Alexandra, from the age of 11, when Bennell was one of the youth-team coaches.
results.webTitle: Six come forward after Andy Woodward’s story of abuse at Crewe
